overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a robust approach to time-series forecasting with limited historical data (96 hourly points). It focuses on handling anomalies, identifying daily patterns, and implementing a simple yet effective median-based method for multi-step forecasting. The analysis prioritizes data quality assessment and practical heuristics over complex models due to data constraints.
common_data_patterns: Daily seasonality (peaks in evening, dips at night)
Anomaly detection (constant value day identified as outlier)
No missing values in provided segment
Hourly pattern consistency across non-anomalous days
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous data points to prevent forecast skew
Use of median (instead of mean) for robustness against outliers
Pattern repetition for multi-period forecasting when historical data is limited
Hourly alignment of historical data for daily pattern extraction
Timestamp handling and output formatting precision considerations
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed data analysis: Combines anomaly detection, pattern extraction, and heuristic implementation while acknowledging limitations of advanced models given sparse data.
